overview_of_class: The course will center on the tension between the nation's foundational promise of equality and the profound inequalities that have run through the American experience since the Civil War. It will pay particular attention to racial and class dynamics as they operated within the American economic system and to the United States' relationship to other nations, from the imperialist drives of the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries to the intensified globalization of recent decades.
name: History of the United States, Reconstruction to the Present
subject: HISTORY
